cards.originalText: Pillar of Flame deals 2 damage to any target. If a creature dealt damage this way would die this turn, exile it instead.

rulings.text: A creature dealt damage by Pillar of Flame that dies this turn will be exiled even if it wasn’t the target of Pillar of Flame (because the damage was redirected somehow). If the target creature isn’t dealt damage (most likely because the damage was prevented), it won’t be exiled if it dies that turn.
A creature dealt damage by Pillar of Flame will be exiled no matter why the creature would die that turn. It could have its toughness reduced to 0 or less or be destroyed by another spell or ability.

cards.name: Ciaran, Blade of the Lords
cards.originalText:
Deathtouch
As Ciaran, Blade of the Lords enters the battlefield, each opponent chooses a creature card name.
Ciaran can't be blocked except by creatures with one of the chosen names.

rulings.text: Only names of actual creature cards can be used. For example, Wandering Fumarole cannot be named even if a Wandering Fumarole on the battlefield is currently a creature. Similarly, most tokens cannot be named, with the exception of tokens with names that are also creature card names. At the time of this ruling, the only such tokens other than token copies are Assembly-Worker, Cloud Sprite, Festering Goblin, Goldmeadow Harrier, Kobolds of Kher Keep, Llanowar Elves, Metallic Sliver, Nightmare, Shapeshifter, and Spark Elemental.

Desperation (This creature may despair as it attacks. If it does, sacrifice it at the beginning of the next end step.)
When Lautrec, the Embraced despairs, defending player reveals their hand. You choose a nonland card from it and exile it. You may cast that card for as long as it remains exiled, and you may spend mana as though it were mana of any type to cast that spell.

rulings.text: The types of mana are white, blue, black, red, green, and colorless. The despair trigger doesn't allow you to spend mana as though it were mana from, say, an artifact source or a snow source.
